tasks.title: The Mystery of the Siberian Sea
tasks.question: The lake in the photo is the deepest in the world, often called the 'Siberian Sea.' What is its name?
tasks.explanation: Lake Baikal in Siberia is the world's deepest lake, reaching 1,642 meters, with its ice forming unique patterns.

tasks.title: Code of the Fiery Mountain
tasks.question: The photo shows the highest active volcano in Eurasia, located in Kamchatka. Enter its name in all capital letters without hyphens to crack the code!
tasks.explanation: Klyuchevskaya Sopka is a majestic volcano in Kamchatka, a symbol of its wild nature.

tasks.title: Crossword of Natural Wonders
tasks.question: Fill in the crossword to uncover the natural wonders of Asian Russia, guided by the clues provided.

clues.hint: The world’s deepest lake, a Siberian gem
Kamchatka’s tallest volcano, a fiery landmark (Sopka)
Sacred mountain in Altai, capped with eternal snow
Peninsula famed for geysers and volcanoes
Unique rock pillars in Yakutia, a natural marvel

tasks.explanation: This crossword highlights key natural landmarks of Asian Russia.

tasks.title: The Riddle of the Geysers
tasks.question: The reserve in the photo is home to Kamchatka’s boiling geysers. What is its name?
tasks.explanation: Kronotsky Reserve in Kamchatka is renowned for its Valley of Geysers.

tasks.title: Crossword of Natural Zones
tasks.question: Complete the crossword to explore the natural zones and landmarks of Asian Russia, using the clues provided.

clues.hint: Kamchatka reserve known for its geyser valley
River flowing into Lake Baikal
Republic home to Belukha Mountain
Republic with the Lena Pillars
Peninsula of volcanoes and rugged beauty

tasks.explanation: This crossword covers natural zones and iconic landmarks of Asian Russia.

tasks.title: Journey to the Mountains
tasks.question: Where should you go to see mountain landscapes like those in the photo?
tasks.explanation: Altai is a prime destination for mountain landscapes and ecotourism.

tasks.title: Peninsula Cipher
tasks.question: This peninsula is a land of volcanoes and geysers. Enter its name in all capital letters without hyphens to solve the cipher!
tasks.explanation: Kamchatka is a unique region where fire and water meet in nature.

tasks.title: Regions of Natural Wonders
tasks.question: Select the region for each natural landmark:
tasks.explanation: Correct regions: Baikal — Irkutsk Oblast and Buryatia, Lena Pillars — Yakutia, Klyuchevskaya Sopka and Valley of Geysers — Kamchatka Krai, Belukha Mountain — Altai Republic.

tasks.title: Where Are These Treasures Located?
tasks.question: Select the region for each natural landmark:
tasks.explanation: Correct regions: Taymyr Lake — Krasnoyarsk Krai, Sayano-Shushensky Reserve — Khakassia Republic, Krasnoyarsk Pillars — Krasnoyarsk Krai, Ubsunur Hollow — Tuva.

tasks.title: Capital of Siberia
tasks.question: The city in the photo is known as the cultural and scientific hub of Siberia. What is its name?
tasks.explanation: Novosibirsk is the largest city in Siberia, famed for its opera house and Akademgorodok scientific center.

tasks.title: City by Baikal
tasks.question: This city is the gateway to Lake Baikal, a popular tourist destination. Enter its name in all capital letters without hyphens.
tasks.explanation: Irkutsk is a historic city, the closest major center to Lake Baikal.

tasks.title: Crossword of Cities
tasks.question: Fill in the crossword to discover major cities of Asian Russia, guided by the clues provided.

clues.hint: Cultural and scientific capital of Siberia
City closest to Lake Baikal
City on the Yenisei River, a Siberian hub
Port city in the Far East
Capital of Yakutia, city of permafrost

tasks.explanation: This crossword is dedicated to major cities of Asian Russia.

tasks.title: Bridge over the Amur
tasks.question: In which Far Eastern city is the bridge over the Amur River, shown in the photo, located?
tasks.explanation: Khabarovsk is renowned for its bridge over the Amur, a vital transportation hub in the Far East.

tasks.title: Crossword of Landmarks
tasks.question: Complete the crossword to reveal iconic landmarks of Asian Russian cities, using the clues provided.

clues.hint: Famous bridge in Vladivostok, a city symbol
Chapel on a hill in Krasnoyarsk, a local landmark
Cliff in Khabarovsk, named after a river
Museum in Yakutsk dedicated to ancient animals
_____ and ballet theater in Novosibirsk

tasks.explanation: This crossword features iconic landmarks of Asian Russian cities.

tasks.title: City of Bridges
tasks.question: The city in the photo is known for its bridges, including the Golden Bridge. What is its name?
tasks.explanation: Vladivostok is a port city with impressive bridges, such as the Golden Bridge.

tasks.title: Capital of Yakutia
tasks.question: This city is the center of Yakutia, known for its museums and permafrost. Enter its name in all capital letters without hyphens.
tasks.explanation: Yakutsk is the cultural and scientific center of Yakutia, located in a permafrost zone.

tasks.title: Rivers of Cities
tasks.question: Select the river on which each city is located:
tasks.explanation: Correct rivers: Novosibirsk — Ob, Krasnoyarsk — Yenisei, Khabarovsk — Amur, Irkutsk — Angara, Vladivostok — Golden Horn bay.

tasks.title: Roles of Cities
tasks.question: Select the primary characteristic of each city:
tasks.explanation: Correct characteristics: Novosibirsk — scientific center (Akademgorodok), Yakutsk — permafrost zone, Vladivostok — port city, Ulan-Ude — Buddhism center in Russia.

tasks.title: Monument to Pioneers
tasks.question: The monument in the photo is dedicated to the pioneers of Siberia and stands in central Irkutsk. What is its name?
tasks.explanation: The Monument to the City Founders in Irkutsk honors the pioneers who explored Siberia.

tasks.title: Code of the Bronze Tiger
tasks.question: This tiger monument is located in a Far Eastern city. Enter the city’s name in all capital letters without hyphens to crack the code!
tasks.explanation: The Amur tiger monument in Vladivostok symbolizes the strength and nature of the Far East.

tasks.title: Crossword of Monuments
tasks.question: Fill in the crossword to uncover famous monuments of Asian Russia, guided by the clues provided.

clues.hint: Admiral honored with a monument in Irkutsk
Explorer commemorated in Khabarovsk
Tsar immortalized in Novosibirsk
Giant head in Ulan-Ude, a leader’s monument
Heroic pilot with a monument in Novosibirsk

tasks.explanation: This crossword is dedicated to monuments of historical figures in Asian Russia.

tasks.title: Crossword of Symbolic Monuments
tasks.question: Complete the crossword to reveal symbolic monuments of Asian Russia, using the clues provided.

clues.hint: Tiger, a symbol of Vladivostok, named after a river
Artist whose monument adorns Krasnoyarsk
City founders commemorated in Irkutsk
Tsar with a monument in Novosibirsk
Giant head in Ulan-Ude, an era’s symbol

tasks.explanation: This crossword features symbolic monuments of Asian Russia.

tasks.title: Monument in the Square
tasks.question: The monument in the photo is dedicated to a tsar and stands in Novosibirsk. Who is it dedicated to?
tasks.explanation: The Monument to Alexander III in Novosibirsk honors the tsar linked to the Trans-Siberian Railway’s development.

tasks.title: Cities of Monuments
tasks.question: Select the city where each monument is located:
tasks.explanation: Correct cities: Monument to Alexander III — Novosibirsk, Monument to Khabarov — Khabarovsk, Monument to Lenin (giant head) — Ulan-Ude, Monument to the Amur Tiger — Vladivostok.

tasks.title: Who Are the Monuments Dedicated To?
tasks.question: Select who each monument is dedicated to:
tasks.explanation: Correct dedications: Monument in Irkutsk — Pioneers, Monument in Novosibirsk — Alexander III, Monument in Krasnoyarsk — artist Pozdeev, Monument in Khabarovsk — explorer Khabarov.
